{{/* go:code func diction() // func dict (string, a int) string func dict (string, int) string func ddd(dd) func dd(d djd d) func bro(_, _ string) string */}} {{ }} {{ dd "hell" }} {{ dict "hellen" "output" }} {{ 23 | dict 44 }} {{ dict "222" 23 }} {{ brandon "mis" }} {{ $dict := "hello" }} {{ $dict "jjjj" }} {{ $dict }} {{ dict }} {{ dandelion }} {{ $var := "hello" }} {{ $var = 23 }} {{ $ := "elton" }} // this one right here should be a big no-no, redefining $ is not good (analysis) although it is valid syntax {{ $. := "elton" }} should through an error as well (bad syntax) {{ $.angolmoi }} // should not through an error if '$' stills refer to initial input (only linting error is possible, not syntax error) {{ $.ban }} {{ $.planet := "elton" }} // must through an error {{ $.planet = "elton" }} // must through an error because of the assignment {{ .planet = "hello" }} // must through an error source = ` {{ concat (((upper "world") )"--breaker" }} `. The previous text is valid under html/template rule, make it pass {{- /*go:code func dandelion(int) int */ -}} {{ }} {{ | }} {{ $ }} {{ jor := "jd" }} {{ $val := "hello" }} {{ $val := "the storm" }} {{ define "titi" }} {{ $val := "calco" }} {{ $val }} {{ $ }} {{ . }} {{ end }} {{ $val }} {{ define "titi" }} {{ end }} {{ define "tonton" .Pal }} {{ define "uncle" }} {{ end }} {{ end }} {{ if ((true)) }} {{ define "tata" }} {{ end }} {{ end }} {{ template "tonton" . }} {{ template "tata" . }}
